TopicTitle: Onto Earth - One off story explaining the existence of Kerbals

Articles.Content:
This is just a quick thing I wrote to exercise my writing.

The engineers on the Freya station scrambled to operate the RCS. The speakers blared a dire warning- missile approaching.

The station could take no more. The shields had been taken down by a Kraken ship earlier that orbit, and the one remaining evacuation ship had some heat tiles blown off.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Control to Freya, Control to War Station Freya!Ã¢â‚¬Â a small speaker at the bridge buzzed. The comms officer rushed to the microphone and pushed down the button to talk. Ã¢â‚¬Å“Freya comms in.Ã¢â‚¬Â he said, keeping a level head through all the panic.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Tell captain Bill - this is code black.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Code black? The comms officer felt fear rise in his chest. Code black meant certain death.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Affirmative.Ã¢â‚¬Â he replied, his voice cracking as he opened the channel to BillÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s radio. Being a comms officer meant you had to tell all the bad news.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Captain Bill!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Code black.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Silence for a few seconds, then Ã¢â‚¬Å“Then spacefaring civilisation is finished.Ã¢â‚¬Â

That couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t happen. Ã¢â‚¬Å“WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re- the last ship?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes. Now listen, thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s only about five minutes until impact. Take the DNA banks, put them in a safe box and send them down to Earth.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“But the evac ship will need a pilot-Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“I know. You and Bob go together. BobÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll fly.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll die.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“You were going to die anyway.Ã¢â‚¬Â

The captainÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s flat voice made the comms officer cringe.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“RightÃ¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â

He shook and he quivered as he voiced his next words.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“It was nice to know you, Bill.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“You too, Jeb.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jebediah thought back on the hectic last day as the explosion from Freya bolstered him and Bob further into the atmosphere.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“BobÃ¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“I know.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Where are we headed?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“At our predicted trajectory, we (and the box) will land at a coastal area to the south-west of the Keru ranges.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“CanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t you take it inland?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“We used up all fuel on deorbit.Ã¢â‚¬Â

A few tense moments of silence passed, then Bob spoke again.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“The DNA wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be able to grow outside of the box.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“****.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“But if we take it out, then-Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a risk we have to take.Ã¢â‚¬Â Jebediah snapped. Ã¢â‚¬Å“WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re dying anywayÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ Who cares about DNA poisoning at a time like this?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Suddenly the ship lurched upwards and gravity bit in. Jeb called out in alarm as his face was slammed in the back window, giving him a perfect view of the disintegrating heat tiles being ripped off behind him. The back seats folded up as the ship lurched, revealing an empty cardboard box in the storage underneath.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Where are the parachutes?Ã¢â‚¬Â Jeb yelled to Bill. A puncture in the hull began to leak air, and Bill passed out as a mug smashed into his head. Jeb was alone now.

He crawled forwards in the increasing gravity, grabbing onto the box just in time. A huge chunk of hull was ripped off and Jeb was torn out by the whirling air.

He was now out in empty space, and his emergency vac-suit automatically encased him in a see-through bubble.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Release the latchÃ¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â Jeb grunted with his ever decreasing air supply. Ã¢â‚¬Å“4-3-8-2Ã¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â

The case beeped negatively- Jeb had slipped and pushed the wrong code, and now blackness was creeping in his vision.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“4Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ 3Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ 8Ã¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â he typed ever slower as his whole existence was swallowed. Earth can wait, he thought to himself, I just need to sleepÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ Those were his last memories.

JebediahÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s vacuum bubble burst and shock heating obliterated his body as his ship disintegrated. The safe however, was heat proof, and as a flaming piece of debris span by it hit the padÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ On number two. The air swung it open, and the DNA of the future world dominators was sprinkled through the air like a godly rain.

This DNA fell to the ground and smashed into the grass, seeping into its structure. Influenced by its new programming, eventually it grew into a hybrid of human and plant, into a new world dominating species known as... The Kerbals.
Thanks! This isn't my best writing, but obviously it was okay because you enjoyed it.
